pull.title: appveyor: Enable multiwallet tests
pull.body:
Based on #14320 

This PR enable multiwallet test on appveyor. Also re-enable symlink tests on Windows which is available after Windows Vista.

I disable these tests in #13964 because I suppose that Windows does not support symlink, but I was wrong.

events.body:
Concept ACK

Thanks for all your good appveyor work!

utACK 118f64736dc9121ea9ce3159d64c66406f92bc13. Change is essentially the same as 02b6bd343da296dc29ea017447b18c9afa13b5e3 previously reviewed in #14320, except symlinks are allowed in some more cases in the multiwallet test.

comments.body: Wild pointers  scary stuff! Would you be able to construct a test case triggering that? What would it take to get rid of them?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,7 +143,7 @@ def wallet_file(name):
 
         self.restart_node(0, extra_args)
 
-        assert_equal(set(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), set(['', 'w3', 'w2', 'sub/w5', 'w7', 'w7', 'w8_copy', 'w1', 'w8', 'w']))
+        assert_equal(set(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), set(['', 'w3', 'w2', os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w7', 'w7', 'w8_copy', 'w1', 'w8', 'w']))
comments.body: In windows it is possible to set `-wallet=sub/w5`, `listwallets` gives `sub/w5` but `listwalletdir` gives `sub\w5`?
@practicalswift This is the code from #14320. Better to move to [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14320#discussion_r220332273). It might can be resolved by #11911

-        assert_equal(set(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), set(['', 'w3', 'w2', 'sub/w5', 'w7', 'w7', 'w8_copy', 'w1', 'w8', 'w']))
+        assert_equal(set(map(lambda w: w['name'], self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets'])), set(['', 'w3', 'w2', os.path.join('sub', 'w5'), 'w7', 'w7', 'w8_copy', 'w1', 'w8', 'w']))
comments.body: Yes, unless we change to calling `fs::path::generic_string()` instead of calling `fs::path::string()`
